intro: Aeschynomene tuberculata, commonly known as the hairy burr sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a small annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Aeschynomene tuberculata is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
